pr_title: Resolves #828: RankedSet poorly split for non-random keys

timeline.message:
Resolves #828: RankedSet poorly split for non-random keys
Introduces an index option for RANK and TIME_WINDOW_LEADERBOARD indexes that controls what hash function is used.
Note that while it is technically safe to change the hash function for existing data, this is not recommended, as it changes the distribution.

Resolves #828: RankedSet poorly split for non-random keys

Note that while it is technically safe to change the hash function for existing data, this is not recommended, as it changes the distribution.

timeline.bodyText: While the other lines in this comment are aren't needed any more, I think this first line is still valuable.
timeline.author: alecgrieser

timeline.bodyText: Interesting. I suppose we could loosen this to allow for the rank hash function to change (given that it should be compatible). I'm not opposed to being stricter for now, though perhaps that should be an option at some point.
timeline.author: alecgrieser

replies.bodyText: Yes. I thought being conservative during the transition was best.
replies.author: MMcM

timeline.bodyText: I suppose using a registry rather than an enum is more idiomatic (e.g., FunctionKeyExpressions) and allows a user to provide their own implementation. I think that switching to a registry in the future is compatible with this current approach, though, so maybe it's fine as is for now. (Perhaps there should be an Issue about it.)
timeline.author: alecgrieser

replies.bodyText:
Yes. It's also possible that some additional options will require more state.
For example, if we wanted one that seeded Murmur3 from, say, the leaderboard time window id instead of always using 0.
replies.author: MMcM

replies.bodyText: I didn’t make it extensible, but as a top level regular class it is now maybe a bit more registry like
replies.author: MMcM

replies.bodyText: Yeah, and even though it's not extensible now, it looks like the kind of thing that could be made a registry if/when needed.
replies.author: alecgrieser

timeline.bodyText: This kind of feels like a private class, at least until the user can provide their own hash function implementation (instead of using the enum).
timeline.author: alecgrieser

replies.bodyText: I moved it out into the replacement for the enum and made it private
replies.author: MMcM

timeline.bodyText: As this enum is in an INTERNAL class, it's technically "unadvised" for users to use this, but the alternative is they need their own constants in their code if they want to use the names here. I suppose we could leave it here if we're not "entirely happy" with this API (yet?), or move it out.
timeline.author: alecgrieser

replies.bodyText: I made this top level. Since that meant it should own the other statics and enum init order is fixed, I needed to also make it a regular class.
replies.author: MMcM

timeline.message: Move enum out to top level as a regular class.
Move enum out to top level as a regular class.
Move enum out to top level as a regular class.
Allow RankedSet to have different hash functions.

Note that while it is technically safe to change the hash function for existing data, this is not recommended, as it changes the distribution.
